intro: Dryandra prionotes, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia, where it typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to dry, Mediterranean-type climates and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
